metadata.title: CVE-2015-3409 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
Untrusted search path vulnerability in Module::Signature before 0.75 allowslocal users to gain privileges via a Trojan horse module under the currentworking directory, as demonstrated by a Trojan horse Text::Diff module.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-3409` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libmodule-signature-perl - 0.73-1ubuntu0.14.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: libmodule-signature-perl package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '0.73-1ubuntu0.14.04.1').
